description: Demolition of existing building and erection of new 5 and part 6 storey building comprising Class B1 business use at ground level, with 4 studios and 27 cluster flats for students above.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - Detailed drawings, or samples of materials as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council before the relevant part of the work is begun:
a)	Samples of all colours and materials to be used on facing surfaces;
b)	Typical details of all external doors, windows and window openings (including surrounds), and balconies at 1:20 scale.
The relevant parts of the works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and N13 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until:
a)	The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination and landfill gas for approval by the Council; and
b)	The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council. All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial/storage use of the site in accordance with policy EN10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - The student cycle parking provision shown on the approved ground floor plan shall be provided and fitted with appropriate cycle racks/stands prior to the occupation of the student accommodation hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter and used only for the purposes of the storage of bicycles by residents and visitors.

Reason: To ensure that the development is appropriately provided with this facility in accordance with policy TR22 and standard DS10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - Nothwithstanding the information shown on the approved proposed site and ground floor plan, amended details in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before the relevant part of the work is begun; 
a)	car parking layout for the B1 unit(s) consisting of not more than 2 car spaces (1 to disabled specification);
b)	cycle parking for the B1 unit(s) consisting of 8 stands positioned adjacent to the four B1 entrances;
c)	bin store location for the student accommodation affording direct access from the parking and loading area or as otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.
The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with such details as have been approved.

Reason: In order to provide for the adequate service and parking needs of the site in accordance with policy standards DS8, DS9 and DS10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 8 - Before the use commences sound insulation shall be provided for the building in accordance with the approved noise assessment report. The use shall thereafter not be carried out other than in complete compliance with the approved scheme.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy RE2 and EN5 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - Details as to how possible unreasonable noise disturbance from the first floor terrace area will be avoided shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any construction work begins on site. Such approved details shall be fully implemented and retained permanently.

Reason: So that the Council may be satisfied that unreasonable disturbance to neighbours is avoided in accordance with policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
